summary: Small "critical access" hospitals are often the only source of health care in rural communities. While they provide emergency mental health care, only some provide other in- and outpatient psychiatric care. Medicare generally pays these hospitals at cost, but most inpatient psychiatric services aren't eligible for cost-based payment. Hospital officials had mixed views on whether this swayed decisions to offer inpatient psychiatric care. Medicare payments...
title: Critical Access Hospitals: Views on How Medicare Payment and Other Factors Affect Behavioral Health Services
